page.title: 01Grass Crofts and Sea
page.content: Low hills slope broadly down to the sea.In the summer the grass fields are alive with cattle, in the winter only the curlew and a handful of sheep occupy this largely empty area. The cattle have been sold or are wintering in byres. About every fifth field stands a dwelling, many that are still inhabited are modern. Only a few of the numerous crofts are lived in, most decay or store hay. Those that are inhabited belong to an incoming class of people who earn their living not from the land, but by tourism which is on the increase or work which permits them to be distant from their source of income i.e. writng,painting etc. Overall, the dominant force is nature, its furious winds long and short seasonsal days and swiftly changing drama.Its sea & sky that's sovereign.
